conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds.
Velocity at t = 2 seconds is 0 m/s.
Velocity at t = 3 seconds is -2 m/s.
Positive direction is defined by the direction of the velocity.
At t = 2 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s, meaning the particle is at rest.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, velocity becomes negative, indicating motion opposite to the positive direction.
Motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
